description: Dhcp leases are stored in memory by dnsmasq.  When an instance is terminated it doesn't always send a dhcp_release packet so the lease is still stored in the internal lease db.  It is only removed when the dhcp lease exipres.  In other words, you can't re-use an ip address for a new instance unless you are willing to wait up to --dhcp_lease_time seconds.
title: dhcp leases are not released on instance termination
